definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: She seems like a kook, but she is just grand, really.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去有點兒怪，不過她確實是個好人兒。

sentences.english: His remarks irritated me a little.
sentences.chinese: 他的話讓我有點兒惱火。

sentences.english: They're a bit foxed by the colours of the riders' jerseys and hats.
sentences.chinese: 自行車手運動衫和帽子的顏色讓他們有點兒困惑。

sentences.english: Lily:I'm sorry, I'm feeling carsick. Would you drive a little slower, please?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我有點兒暈車。能開慢點兒嗎？

sentences.english: Some people may think this dish is sightly hot for their taste.
sentences.chinese: 有些人會覺得對他們的口味來說，這道萊有點兒辣。

sentences.english: OK.And if I substitute it again, This is going by a little fast.
sentences.chinese: 如果繼續下去就是，這有點兒快。

sentences.english: It was just a little too preachy-sounding, Mr. Vitrano says.
sentences.chinese: 維特拉諾說，聽上去有點兒像是在說教。

sentences.english: Then wed have some ideas of what youll be needing.
sentences.chinese: 那麼我們就會意中有點兒數，曉得你們需求什麼了。

sentences.english: You may find this a bit overcomplicated, so I will simplify it.
sentences.chinese: 您可能發現這有點兒過於複雜，所以我將簡化它。

sentences.english: 'There's got to be a little gallows humor to get you through the day,' Mr. Obama said.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬說，總得有點兒黑色幽默讓人們撐下去。

sentences.english: It’s sort of like punching your bride right before saying “I do”.
sentences.chinese: 這有點兒像在你說“我願意”之前把你的新娘打一頓。

sentences.english: The beehive did sort of look like a big brown bear now.
sentences.chinese: 蜂巢現在看起來的確有點兒像一隻大棕熊。

sentences.english: The clothes feel a bit damp.
It's a little overweight. You have to pay extra.
sentences.chinese: 有點兒超重了，您得付超重費。

sentences.english: The bird is not itself today.
sentences.chinese: 這隻鳥今天有點兒反常。
